title: Senators Strike Deal for Swift Passage of Bill to Avert US Default
description: Senators reached a deal to expedite passage late Thursday of a debt-ceiling agreement forged by President Joe Biden and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy as a June 5 deadline for a destabilizing US default approaches.

title: Disney-DeSantis Judge Steps Aside Over Relative’s Shares
description: US District Judge Mark Walker recused himself from Walt Disney Co.’s lawsuit against Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, citing a potential conflict because a family member owns stock in the entertainment company.

title: Government Deliberately Squandered Billions in Rail Dispute, Union Says
description: The biggest rail workers' union has accused the Government of "deliberately squandering" billions of pounds in the long-running dispute over pay, jobs and conditions.

title: Trump’s Criminal Defense Attorney Now Representing Him in Federal Probes
description: Todd Blanche, a former prosecutor who resigned from an elite law firm to defend Donald Trump against New York criminal charges, is now also involved in the former president’s defense in federal investigations, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: French Envoy Says Taiwan’s Status Quo May Be the Best Result Possible
description: The French government believes that forcing a confrontation with China over Taiwan isn’t in the best interest of the West, saying the island’s current ambiguous status may be the best for all concerned, according to France’s new envoy to Washington.

title: Russia Accuses US Intelligence of Hacking Thousands of iPhones
description: Russia’s main security service accused a US intelligence agency of hacking several thousand iPhones, including devices belonging to Russian nationals and others linked to diplomatic missions and embassies in the country.

title: India’s Gandhi Slams Modi Over Economy, Democracy on US Visit
description: Indian opposition leader Rahul Gandhi, on a visit to the US, accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of making economic missteps and undermining democratic institutions, just weeks before President Joe Biden hosts him for a state dinner.

title: Sunak Quietly Tries to Fix China Ties Without Upsetting UK Hawks
description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is trying to repair the UK’s relationship with China without being seen doing it.

title: McCarthy’s Debt Deal Avoids Default But May Worsen Recession
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. We’re still focused on the debt-ceiling drama. Today, Emily Birnbaum looks at the economic impact (spoiler: it’s not great). Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Biden Plans to Tap Mandy Cohen for CDC Director, Replacing Walensky
description: President Joe Biden intends to nominate Mandy Cohen, North Carolina’s former health secretary who led the state’s response to the pandemic, to be director of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: BRICS Nations Say New Currency May Offer Shield From Sanctions
description: BRICS nations asked the bloc’s specially created bank to provide guidance on a how a potential new shared currency might work, including how it could shield other member countries from the impact of sanctions such as those imposed on Russia.

title: Banxico Signals a Long Period of Tight Monetary Policy to Tame Inflation
Biden Falls at Air Force Academy’s High-Altitude Commencement
description: President Joe Biden tumbled on stage Thursday after delivering remarks at the US Air Force Academy commencement, but the White House said he was not hurt.

title: The Treasury Is Bending Over Backwards to Avoid Breaching the Debt Cap
description: The government continues maneuvering under the ceiling as coffers run low and the Treasury has warned it might need to postpone some bill auctions

title: Trump Blasts DeSantis for Telling Voters He’s Limited to One Term
description: Donald Trump is pushing back on Ron DeSantis for telling voters he is preferable to the former president who can only serve one more term if elected.

title: EU Allies Demand Kosovo Repeat Local Vote That Sparked Violence
description: European allies increased pressure on Serbia and Kosovo to de-escalate tensions, demanding they hold new local elections in the troubled north that has seen the worst violence in a decade.

title: Rishi Sunak Refuses to Hand Over WhatsApp Texts to UK’s Covid Inquiry
description: Rishi Sunak’s administration refused a demand from the UK’s Covid-19 inquiry to hand over former Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s WhatsApp messages and pandemic diaries, setting up a legal battle that risks amplifying accusations of a cover-up.

title: ITV Boss Called to Face MPs’ Questions Amid This Morning Row
description: ITV boss Dame Carolyn McCall has been called to give evidence to a parliamentary committee to answer questions about the broadcaster's approach to safeguarding and complaint handling following the departure of Phillip Schofield from This Morning.

title: House Committee Launches Probe into FTC Chair Lina Khan
description: The House Oversight Committee is opening an investigation into US Federal Trade Commission Chair Lina Khan, ratcheting up the fight between the GOP and Khan as she attempts to reinvigorate the consumer protection agency.

title: Senate Racing to Pass Debt Bill to Avert June 5 US Default Deadline
description: The US Senate prepared Thursday to take up the debt-limit deal forged by President Joe Biden and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy with some senators threatening to delay the measure as a default deadline nears.

title: Sunak Still Considering How to Respond to Covid Inquiry Request for Johnson WhatsApp Messages
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said his government is still considering its “next steps” ahead of a deadline imposed by the UK’s official Covid-19 inquiry to hand over former Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s diaries and WhatsApp messages from the pandemic.

title: Stellantis Says No Deal Yet in Canada Battery Plant Subsidy Feud
description: Stellantis NV said there’s no deal yet with the Canadian and provincial governments on public money for an electric-vehicle battery plant in Windsor, Ontario.

title: Russia Says It Repelled Fresh Border Attack From Ukraine
description: Russia said it beat back new cross-border attacks from Ukraine as a regional governor said hundreds of residents had been evacuated to escape shelling.

title: US Hits Sudanese Forces With Sanctions Amid Cease-Fire Collapse
description: The US is turning to economic sanctions in Sudan after continued violence led to the effective collapse of a cease-fire between warring factions in a conflict that’s killed more than a thousand people in the North African nation.

title: Lula to Appoint Personal Attorney to Brazil’s Supreme Court
description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will appoint the lawyer who helped his political comeback to a seat on Brazil’s Supreme Court.

title: Nigeria Central Bank Denies Devaluing Naira as Calls Grow Louder
description: Nigeria’s central bank dismissed a report that it had devalued the naira as traders raised bets for it to weaken by almost a third, days after President Bola Tinubu said his administration will seek to end the nation’s multiple-currency regime

title: EU Raises Alarm Over Chinese Demands for Cosmetics Trade Secrets
description: The European Union has raised concerns with China about the detailed product information that cosmetics companies like L’Oreal and LVMH have to provide in order to sell their goods in the country.

title: Angola Cuts Fuel Subsidy, Following Nigeria in Boosting Pump Prices
description: Angola reduced its gasoline subsidy, almost doubling pump prices in a nation that has some of the world’s cheapest fuel.

title: Japan Police Report Blames Security Lapses for Pipe Bomb Attack on PM Kishida
description: TOKYO (AP) — Japan's National Police Agency said in a report Thursday that flaws in basic security such as an absence of metal detectors and bag checks allowed an attacker to enter a campaign crowd unnoticed and throw a pipe bomb at Prime Minister Fumio Kishida in April.

title: Chile’s Economic Activity Stagnates as Investors Bet That Rate Cuts Are Near
description: Chile’s economic activity remained flat in April as investors speculate over which month the central bank will start to lower the benchmark interest rate from an over two-decade high.

title: Violence in Kosovo Exposes Perilous Limbo in Europe’s Powder Keg
description: The worst violence in a decade in Kosovo exposed the political intransigence of a region still in limbo 15 years after the nation declared independence from Serbia, and a tinderbox that takes little to ignite.

title: Brazil’s Economic Growth Bounces Back Under Lula and Defies High Interest Rates
description: Brazil’s economy leaped in the first months of 2023, lifted by bumper harvests that outweighed the drag of double-digit borrowing costs.

title: EU Moves Closer to New Russia Sanctions After Proposals Weakened
description: European Union member states are slowly moving toward an agreement on an 11th sanctions package over Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, as a number of proposals originally put forward by the bloc’s executive arm are set to be watered down.

title: Putin Arrest Warrant Prompts South Africa to Weigh Moving BRICS Summit
description: South Africa is considering switching the venue of an upcoming summit of BRICS leaders to another country, according to people familiar with the matter, a move that would resolve its dilemma over whether to execute an international arrest warrant for Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: Thousands More Londoners Will Be Able to Swap Polluting Vehicles for Greener Alternatives
description: Thousands more Londoners will be able to swap their polluting vehicles for greener alternatives, the London mayor has announced.

title: Tories Ramp Up Pressure on Sunak to Abolish UK Inheritance Tax
description: A group of Conservative politicians who previously supported Liz Truss and Boris Johnson are trying to convince Prime Minister Rishi Sunak to abolish UK inheritance tax, as his government considers reforming the levy to boost the struggling party’s chances at the next general election.

title: The Rising Stars Zimbabwe’s Ruling Party Hopes Will Win It Votes
description: Zimbabwe’s ruling party, which has retained power for more than four decades through a series of disputed votes, is undergoing a makeover by adding fresh faces to its lineup of lawmaker candidates to contest upcoming elections.

title: Thailand to Shrink Rank of Generals Amid Conscription Debate
description: Thailand will slash the number of army generals by 50% over the next four years, according to the nation’s defense ministry, amid a pledge by a coalition of pro-democracy parties that won the May election to end conscription and reduce military spending.

title: Indian Leader Warns Tribal Insurgents in State Bordering Myanmar
description: India’s federal government warned tribal insurgent groups not to disrupt the peace in the northeastern state of Manipur bordering Myanmar where recent ethnic clashes left 70 people dead.

title: Japan to Spend About $25 Billion on Families to Boost Births
description: Japan will spend around ¥3.5 trillion ($25 billion) on policies meant to bolster its sliding birthrate, Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said Thursday, without fully explaining how he will fund the plans.

title: Australia Trade Minister Heads to Europe Aiming to Seal EU-FTA
description: Australia’s Trade Minister Don Farrell will head to Brussels this weekend for the final rounds of negotiations on a free trade agreement with the European Union, which both sides signaled may be completed by the end of the European summer.

title: France and Germany Are Split Over Ukraine’s Appeal to Join NATO
description: France is pushing for a concrete path for Ukraine to join the NATO military alliance, but Germany is urging more caution about discussing membership in light of Russia’s ongoing war.

title: The US-Led World Order Faces a New Challenge
description: The BRICS group of emerging nations is accelerating its drive to become a serious economic and political force.

title: Eskom Latest: Spar Retailers’ Diesel Bill at $35 Million
description: Food and liquor retailer Spar Group Ltd. estimates its outlets spent more than 700 million rand ($35 million) on diesel to run generators in the six months through March.

title: A Third of Irish Corporate Taxes Are Paid by Just Three Firms
description: About a third of Ireland’s corporate tax revenues were paid by three corporate groups in 2021, according to new research which indicates the country’s tax receipts are even more concentrated than previously thought.

title: Fewer French Support Protests Against Pension Reform, Poll Shows
description: French backing for strikes and demonstrations against President Emmanuel Macron’s already enacted pension reform has declined, according to a poll published Thursday.

title: Fear of US-China Conflict Looms Over Singapore Defense Forum
description: Asian leaders accustomed to straddling the US-China divide are increasingly nervous that tensions between the world’s two superpowers could spiral toward conflict, with a series of decisions on both sides making it harder for Beijing and Washington to find common ground.

title: Serb President Urges Removal of New Mayors in North Kosovo
description: Serbia’s president called for the removal of new mayors in northern Kosovo, a step he said was needed to de-escalate tensions after the worst violence there in a decade.

title: Singapore, China Agree to Set Up High-Level Defense Hotline
description: China and Singapore agreed to work toward establishing a secure defense telephone link for high-level communications, as the two nations seek to bolster ties amid rising regional tensions.

title: Zelenskiy Visits Summit in Moldova as European Leaders Meet
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy made an unexpected appearance at a summit in neighboring Moldova the same day Russia rained more missiles down on Kyiv.

title: Taiwan, US Cyber Teams Held Rare Meeting at California Consulate
description: US and Taiwanese security officials discussed how companies from the self-governing island could adopt key US defense supply chain standards during a relatively rare meeting on American soil in April, according to a senior government official in Taipei.

title: Ukraine Recap: Missile Attack Hits Kyiv as NATO Talks Membership
description: Ukraine’s capital was hit by a missile barrage overnight, the 19th such attack in the last month. While the missiles were intercepted, Kyiv Mayor Vitali Klitschko said at least three people were killed, including two children, by debris.

title: Nepal Wants Better Terms for Gurkha Fighters Joining Indian Army
description: Nepal Prime Minister Puspha Kamal Dahal will use his trip to India to push for better terms for Gurkha fighters recruited for India’s army, posing a test for New Delhi as it vies for influence with Beijing in the Himalayan nation.

title: Ramaphosa Deploys Envoys to Explain South Africa’s Russia Stance
description: South Africa’s president will send four of his cabinet ministers to Group of Seven nations to explain the country’s non-aligned position on Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: US Birthrate Dips Slightly in 2022 After Rebound in Prior Year
description: The US birth rate declined slightly last year after picking up in 2021 from a multi-decade low in 2020, when the pandemic struck.

title: BRICS Seize Chance to Counter US With Expansion, Common Currency
description: The BRICS group of emerging markets is ramping up its bid for greater global influence, sensing a moment to capitalize on the splintering world order to build out its ranks beyond Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa.

title: Russia’s Rupee Trap Is Adding to $147 Billion Hoard Stuck Abroad
description: A lopsided trade relationship with India is forcing Russia to accumulate up to $1 billion each month in rupee assets that remain stranded outside the country, swelling the stockpile of capital it’s amassed abroad since the invasion of Ukraine.

title: Sweden Pins NATO Ambitions on Terror Law in Bid to Sway Erdogan
description: Sweden is hoping its plans to become the 32nd member of NATO will get back on track on Thursday when its strictest terror laws to date enter into force.

title: Kevin McCarthy’s Debt-Limit Win Risks His Job as Speaker
description: Five months ago, Kevin McCarthy looked unlikely to forge a bipartisan agreement to help avert a disastrous US default.

title: Kim’s Sister Insists on Pyongyang’s Right to Launch Satellite
description: The powerful sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un warned no country can deny Pyongyang’s right to put a spy satellite into space and vowed to put one in orbit soon following Wednesday’s failed launch.

title: Brazil Congress Backs Lula’s Cabinet, But Tests His Green Agenda
description: Brazil’s lower house of congress approved a provisional measure establishing the structure of President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s cabinet, a relief for the leftist leader whose government was nearly thrown into chaos.

title: Debt-Limit Deal Wins House Passage, Easing US Default Concerns
description: The House passed debt-limit legislation forged by President Joe Biden and Speaker Kevin McCarthy that would impose restraints on government spending through the 2024 election and avert a destabilizing US default.

title: Bangladesh Readies Higher Taxes in Budget in Test of IMF Reforms
description: Bangladesh is expected to propose raising taxes and boosting spending in its annual budget Thursday that will serve as a test of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina’s prudent policymaking over populism ahead of elections due next year.

title: Singapore PM Turns Covid Positive Again in a Week, Feels Fine
description: Singapore’s Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong has tested positive again for Covid-19 but is feeling fine, he says in a Facebook post.

title: How a Covert Relationship With the Taliban Backfired for US Ally Pakistan
description: About two weeks after the Taliban retook Afghanistan in 2021, the then head of Pakistan’s spy agency arrived at one of Kabul’s plushest hotels, smiling, sipping tea and appearing at ease with the militants’ return to power.
